exceptions.exn: The term "lt" has type "nat -> nat -> Prop" while it is expected to have type "nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop" (cannot unify "Prop" and "nat -> Prop").

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
SeparationAlgebra nat

Premises:
SeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds -> Prop
sum_SA : forall (A B : Type) (Join_A : Join A) (Join_B : Join B), SeparationAlgebra A -> SeparationAlgebra B -> SeparationAlgebra sum_worlds
prod_SA : forall (A B : Type) (Join_A : Join A) (Join_B : Join B), SeparationAlgebra A -> SeparationAlgebra B -> SeparationAlgebra (A * B)
option_SA : forall (worlds : Type) (J : Join worlds), SeparationAlgebra worlds -> SeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
fun_SA : forall (A B : Type) (Join_B : Join B), SeparationAlgebra B -> SeparationAlgebra (A -> B)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Nat.clearbit = fun a n : nat => Nat.ldiff a (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
option_disj_incr_None : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> increasing None
option_disj_dSA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds), SeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
option_ord_incr_None : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> increasing None
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
option_disj_USA' : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> UnitalSeparationAlgebra' (option worlds)
option_disj_USA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> UnitalSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
option_ord_USA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> UnitalSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
Nat.ones = fun n : nat => Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.sqrt = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.sqrt_iter n 0 0 0 : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.ldiff = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise (fun b0 b' : bool => (b0 && negb b')%bool) a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.shiftl = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.double) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.shiftr = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.div2) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.succ = S : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
option_ord_res_None : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> forall n : option worlds, residue n None
option_disj_res_None : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> forall n : option worlds, residue n None
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
option_ord_dSA : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, SeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra worlds -> IncreasingSeparationAlgebra worlds -> DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra (option worlds)
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
join_comm : forall m1 m2 m : ?worlds, join m1 m2 m -> join m2 m1 m where ?worlds : [ |- Type] ?SA : [ |- Join ?worlds] ?SeparationAlgebra : [ |- SeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
Zpower.Zpower_nat = fun z : Z => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => Z) 1%Z (fun _ : nat => Z.mul z) : Z -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => Z) n Argument scopes are [Z_scope nat_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => 0%Z | S n0 => Z.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> Z Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Argument m is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [nat_scope _]
